intro: Crepis heldreichiana, commonly known as the Heldreich's mouse-ear. It is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its rosette of basal leaves and slender, hairy stems. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It is native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans and thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. Crepis heldreichiana is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it adapts to cold and harsh environmental conditions.
